cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina (and 155 mi E of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina)
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest tonight, then bending slowly west to west-southwest across southern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina before drifting inland across central South Carolina through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina coast near Wilmington–Cape Fear, very close to the SC border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Santee River SC northward through coastal North Carolina, including Cape Fear, the Outer Banks, and sounds
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–58 mph) with gusts possibly exceeding 60 mph expected Friday into early Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in and around Charleston Harbor and adjacent coastal areas during times of on-shore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could produce flash flooding in the Charleston area Friday into Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, destructive waves and dangerous rip currents; isolated tornadoes inland as rain bands move onshore.
